dialogues.text: Josie takes this in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, don't you wanna show them -  Gus, Billy Prince, yourself--that  you're not freaked out by the cool  kids anymore? That you can go in  there, be friends with them, and  get your story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, desperately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Plus, if you quit you're no better  than me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Better than I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the spirit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie approaches the school. She's clearly made a new  attempt at style- she's teetering on too-high platform  shoes and showing a blending white midriff. No one pays  much attention to her. GEORGE, thirty-something African-American, the epitome of cool, waves Josie over to an open van side door. Josie  looks confused and scurries to the van.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) George! What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just get in the van, Josie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: High-tech surveillance wonderland meets seventies living  room. Tape players and monitors share space with shag  carpeting and a mini-fridge. Barry White PLAYS on a TAPE. George starts to wrap wire around Josie's waist. He pins kid's plastic "captain's wings" onto her collar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hidden camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wings?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We used it for our expose on  overweight flight attendants--"Is  That Why They Never Give You a  Second Bag of Nuts?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing this until I speak  with Gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (through speaker) Geller, stop being a pain in the  ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie looks all around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, it's the Great and Powerful  Oz. Now listen--you're in over  your head. This is how it's gonna  work. I review the tapes, I find  your story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What if I say no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bet Good Housekeeping would go  gaga over the cole slaw piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Josie's look of concern...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crush of kids flood up the stairs to the front door of  the school. We see Kirsten, Kristen and Gibby walking thr abreast ahead of Josie up the stairs. The Crowd parts aro them. Josie heads towards them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey! Kirsten, Kristen, Gibby--  What's up girlfriends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The three girls pause and turn just as Josie, caught up i the moment, doesn't see a stray backpack on the stairs in front of her. Josie trips and--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA FACE-PLANTS into the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George watches the monitor, winces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The CAMERA still faces the pavement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (small) I'M OKAY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie is standing, reading from her paper. Sam is rapt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And so it is Rosalind, in disguise,  who is best able to see through  the disguises of others. To say to  Phebe, "Mistress, know thy self,"  to look at love from every angle,  and to realize, finally, that she  is in love with Orlando--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The BELL RINGS. Class is over. Josie puts her stuff away  and starts to follow the Cool Girls out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey guys, wait up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Girls keep moving. Sam stops Josie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Josie, hold on. (then) You've been hiding something from  me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your writing. It's amazing, Josie.  You're really talented. And far  less depressing than Dorothy Parker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you thinking for  college?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: College. Haven't really thought  about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's crazy. I'll get you some  applications.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh no no no no no. See, my family,  we don't go to college. (beat) We just go right into sheep herding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie you owe it to yourself to  go. For your writing. You're a  natural.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Wow. That's--really nice  to hear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie, you're different. When you  speak in class, I can tell--You  actually feel the words-- (touching heart) in here. They're alive. Like-Eurdora  Welty talked about the word it  moon"? How for her it was like a  Concord grape. "That Grandpa took  off his vine and gave to me to  suck out of its skin--"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It --and swallow whole."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both take a breath in. Look away from each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George watches the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita sits on Gus's desk, watches the last scene on Gus's TV, engrossed. Gus walks in and stops the tape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Showtime's over! Move-it! Back to  work!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita climbs off his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus, have you ever been in love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh give it up, Gus. I'm just making  conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love. Who knows what that is? Now  circulation, deadlines, those I  understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should go out every now and  then, Gus; with some new ties the  girls would be all over you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus stares down at his tie. But he's smiling--a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go away. I have enough work here  to last me all night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, I don't have any plans-- you want some help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Roger from op/ed?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie walks toward her locker, the Make out Couple is at  it again. Josie's fed up. She taps the Boy on his shoulde

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Hi. Do you guys have  some kind of schedule I could work  around?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ignores Josie and goes back to his Girlfriend. Aldys, in her Denominator sweatshirt decorated with pins, approaches Josie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, where's your sweatshirt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: В– uhh, must have forgotten-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No biggie. I have an extra in my  locker. I'll get it for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She starts to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh В– I almost forgot В– I'll see  you tonight at Big Cup. 7:30, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie looks confused.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Remember, that poet that we liked  В– the reading he's doing at Big  Cup? I got us tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. 7:30.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm late for lab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aldys takes off. Josie looks down the hall, where Guy,  Kristen and the others are all looking at a flyer pasted  to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is gonna be such a sweet show.  I am so there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy looks at Tommy and Jason, who f follow his lead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah, man, I'll drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's gonna be Rufalicious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) You're using it wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They head off, en masse. Josie goes and looks at the flye "JIMMY CLIFF TONIGHT AT DELLOSER HALL". Josie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marquee reads "Jimmy Cliff." A crowd has gathered by the  door. Josie gets out of cab, and walks towards the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie enters the small, smoky club. She wears what she  considers to be her "hip concert outfit," an outfit that  completely clashes with the Rasta wear of the other conce goers. -She reaches the BOUNCER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Drinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie notices the two Stoners from school standing behind her in line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not 21. I am only seventeen  and I still attend high school.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bouncer stamps her hand. She looks down at her hand. WE CU ON her hand, reading DELLOSER. She enters as the two Stoners approach the Bouncer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as the Stoners look at each other, realizing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Stoner 2) Oh, Dude--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they run out of the club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JIMMY CLIFF is playing. The crowd sits at tables, groovin Josie approaches the bar. A guy turns around--it's Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie--out on a school night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A woman, LARA, emerges from the crowd. And puts her arm  around SAM. An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right, sorry. Lara--Josie.  Josie--Lara. (to Lara) Josie's a student of mine. (to Josie) Lara's my-date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another awkward pause.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, c'mon, let's go dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd roars over Cliff's next song as Lara drags San  off into the crowd. Sam looks back briefly at Josie as we lose him into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: JOSIE
dialogues.text: She sees Guy's group sitting at a table and approaches an empty seat. They immediately scoot around so that the sea is taken. Undeterred, Josie sees a seat at the next table and sits down in it. She looks up to see that she is at a table of huge RASTAFARIANS. They all wear big Rasta hats  and even bigger hair and are smoking a joint the size of  Cuba. She smiles awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Is it okay if I sit here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, ya mon. We accept all peoples.  We are all about da' love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and the Rasta's start to groove to the music. Josie looks over at Guy's table, sees they are toking off a sma joint and passing it around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George and his DATE, a Pam Grier look-alike, sit close on the couch, grooving to the CONCERT PLAYING on the monitor and through the various speakers. CU on the monitor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The joint the size of Cuba is passed INTO FRAME. Josie's  hand takes it. Catching sight of this, George and his Dat exchange concerned looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie is high beyond belief, wearing a big Rasta hat and  loudly laughing her ass off as the Rastas just stare. She can hardly keep herself in her chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it?! Get it?! He was a  firecracker!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She lifts up Rasta 1's dreadlocks to get his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And she cracks up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Rasta #2) I don't love her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rastas share looks ill around. Then Josie hears the first strains of "The Harder They Come"--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! This music rules!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Josie proceeds to get up and take over the place--she dancing on the table, getting up with the band and playin the bongos, all with absolutely no rhythm or style. But  with a lot of whooping. The club is agog. ANGLE ON: Lara and Sam. They both look aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a student of yours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in explanation) She's from Bali.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And as Josie continues to dance on stage, making a total  fool of herself, Jimmy Cliff turns to CAMERA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie is on the phone, and is in the process of finishing an entire pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm telling you, Rob! I think I  did it! I'm totally in! I was soo  cool tonight! You'd be so-- (staring at fork) You know what's a weird word? Fork. (then) Wait! Wait! Did I tell you about  my new friends? I made friends  with a whole table of Rastafarians!   Not one, a whole table! (noting empty pie  plate, suddenly  serious) Oh. My. God. Someone ate my entire  pie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie is asleep where we left her, her head on her hand,  empty pie plate nearby. She wakes, picks her head up. Looks down at her hand, the DELLOSER stamp is faint. CLOSE UP ON her forehead. There  in block letters backwards is "LOSER". She looks up at the clock, which reads: 8:30. She's late. Very late. She grabs her book bag and her keys, and races out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie strides confidently down the hallway, LOSER  prominently on her forehead. She sees Guy and his Group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Guy. Guys. Guy's Guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare, then snicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi loser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group laughs and joins in, saying "Hey Loser." Josie' face registers confusion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We move slowly down the packed hallway, the CAMERA shifti nervously amidst a sea of laughing kids. The LAUGHTER sta to ECHO. Josie starts to walk quickly, then run, through the gaunt of' laughing and pointing kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE HEAR THE LAUGHING, the JOSIE CAM JERKS frantically fro KID to KID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This can not be good--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOSIE CAM P.O.V. WE HEAR Josie BREATHING HEAVILY as she  runs past KIDS who all stare or LAUGH. She makes it to th Girls Room, pushes open the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie goes to the sink, splashes water on her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George watches the monitor, HANDS splash water. A HAND  grabs a paper towel. George can now see Josie reflected i the bathroom mirror. He sees the "LOSER" stamp on her  forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man. Look up, girl. C'mon, Look  up--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie wipes her mouth. Throws the towel away. Goes to exi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George is now apoplectic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: LOOK IN THE MIRROR!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie pauses, goes back to the mirror. She looks up. Sees the stamp. Her hand goes to her mouth in horror. She runs into a stall. JOSIE CAM P.O.V.: WE FACE the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: George looks at the monitor in amazement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A Group is watching Gus's TV, including Burns (the hair  plug man) AND HOWARD (arm casts). They are slack-jawed in shock. WE HEAR O.S. the SOUNDS of Josie VOMITING. Gus sha his head sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like the All-Humiliation  Network.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all nod in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie is in the fetal position on the floor of a stall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The den of Josie's parents' home. Josie is decked out.  She's wearing a pretty hideous metallic pink dress, match gloves, bag, shoes. She's shining her braces, using the  T.V. screen as a mirror. The PHONE RINGS. Josie grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Hey, Billy. I'm ready. Sure, I can  just wait for you on the front  porch. See you in a -uhh- jiffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hangs up. Sixteen year old Rob, very cute and buff,  enters. His pretty GIRLFRIEND is on his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (mouthing to Rob) Jiffer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob just shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. JOSIE'S FRONT PORCH NIGHT, (FLASHBACK)
dialogues.text: Josie, in all her prom splendor, waits out on the front  porch for her date. She sees a LONG, BLACK LIMO turn the corner, headed for  the house. She's hopping up and down with excitement. She checks her reflection in her compact, and then watches th limo approach. The sunroof of the limo opens and Billy Prince, the Adoni of the suburbs, stands up, sticking out of the sunroof. H waves. Josie smiles and waves back. Then, another figure joins Billy's. It's a GORGEOUS BLOND in a slinky dress. She's standing up, sticking out of the sunroof as well. Josie looks a bit confused, but still  tries to smile. Then, she sees them holding things. LITTL THINGS. LITTLE WHITE THINGS. Before Josie realizes what's going on, her metallic ensem is covered in dripping, oozing eggs. One whacks her right in her trifocals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting) Hey, write a poem about this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Billy and his date lob a few more eggs, and their limo  roars off. Josie stands on the porch, alone. She's got eg in her hair, on her face, all over her dress- everywhere. She starts to cry. Softly at first, moving into big, loud wet sobs. She sits down on the porch, her head in her han and just keeps crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homeroom has just gotten out, and the halls are packed  with kids. Josie is running full speed, trying to negotia around lots of kids, in her frantic-race for the door.  Kids still point and stare. She bangs into some freshmen, gets whacked by a book bag, slides some banners that kids are painting - but she won' slow down. Just as she's almost at the doors to the school, the BIG  WOODEN DOOR to the front office opens. Josie can't stop. figure emerges, but before Josie can even see who it is,  she slams into it and goes down. She bangs her head on th hard linoleum floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Homeroom has just gotten out, and the halls are packed  with kids. Josie is running full speed, trying to negotia around lots of kids, in her frantic-race for the door.  Kids still point and stare. She bangs into some freshmen, gets whacked by a book bag, slides some banners that kids are painting - but she won' slow down. Just as she's almost at the doors to the school, the BIG  WOODEN DOOR to the front office opens. Josie can't stop. figure emerges, but before Josie can even see who it is,  she slams into it and goes down. She bangs her head on th hard linoleum floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE SEE two KIDS looking down into the camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--you okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Camera nods "yes" slowly. Tommy and Jason come into frame

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You took a pretty big fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Like every loser should. And  they move out of frame, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As every loser should.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you O.K.? Josie, are you O.K.?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob comes into frame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob is bent over Josie. She rubs her eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been in a horrible accident.  This is a coma-induced nightmare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. Josie, this is real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! That's worse! (beat) What are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob leans in and whispers to Josie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just registered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob whips out his fake ID and shows it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (proudly) Manufactured at the Tiki Post.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob helps Josie up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you crazy?! You can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is it Jos! This is my ninth  inning! The game isn't over--I  just thought it was!  I get on the  Southglen baseball team, the right  scout sees me-- I'm into the minors- it's game time!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're twenty-three years old!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With the reading comprehension of  a fifteen year old! Plus, I'm  popular... You want to be popular...  I can recognize a cry for help  when I see one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear one. (then) Rob, this is so like you. You know,  you can't just come in here and be  popular in just one day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie emerges from the cafeteria line with her tray. A  LOUD CHANT comes from one of the tables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ROB, ROB, ROB

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to see Rob in the middle of a hot dog eating  contest with a HUGE WRESTLER. Rob downs his last one, rai his hands in victory. The CROWD goes WILD. Rob sits down  at Guy's table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dude, you rock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He high-fives Rob. A pretty girl, TRACY approached Rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. I'm Tracy and I'm sixteen and  I'm a gymnast and I don't have a  boyfriend...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looks skyward,  mouths) Thank you. (Then , to Tracy) I'm Rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aldys approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey В– where were you last night? I  was worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie can't take her eyes off Rob sitting at Guy's table. Aldys notices Josie's distraction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Last night. 7:30. Big Cup. I kept  calling you, but I only got your  machine. I don't even know your  parents line and I was really  worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. I forgot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aldys is really hurt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, maybe you should forget about  sitting with us too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie just stands there all alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls P.E. is over. The girls head back to the locker roo Josie lags behind the group, and then wanders over to the baseball diamond, where she hears a bunch of hoots and  hollers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The team is practicing. Rob has just hit a home run with  three men on. EVERYONE CHEERS him on as he runs the bases As he comes into home, he is met with congrats, high five Everyone loves him. Josie watches the whole scene, seething with jealousy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie, post-shower, is wrapped in a towel and carrying he sweaty gym clothes. A group of GIRLS walk by her, gigglin as they exit. She approaches her locker and finds it ajar and completely empty. She looks from the empty locker dow to the sweaty clothes in her hand. A realization sweeps  over her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie shuffles down the hall, still wearing her cheesy  green and yellow gym clothes. She is clearly beaten. She  looks down the hall, stunned. It is ridiculous Rob is being followed by a posse, everyo knows his name. Girls tug on his shirt, guys slap him on  the back or high-five him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Robster, what's up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rob man. My man Rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Robbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi there Robbie Rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie sees Guy approach Rob, and shake his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Robo- how's it going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice pants, man. They are rufus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy smiles. Josie looks like she's going to hurl. She loo down the hall the other way- where a huge banner hangs  that reads:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Rob, see you at the carnival  later?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's Robilicious!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie looks on the wall next to her- and sees a list:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie has seen enough, and walks on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Establishing shot of a smallish carnival, Ferris wheel,  midway, tea cups ride. Near the entrance reads a banner:  "SOUTHGLEN HIGH SENIOR NIGHT".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aldys and the Denominators stand in front of a booth that displays a large glass jar of jellybeans. Calculators and paper out, they're engrossed in find the answer. Josie walks by alone. The Denominators don't notice her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PAN DOWN the line of KIDS waiting to ride the Ferris  wheel. In front are Tommy, Jason, Gibby and Kirsten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has been so much fun! We've  been first in line for every ride!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cuz we cut every line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PAN DOWN to the end of the line, where we find Josie,  standing alone. She's trying her best to keep her game  face on. The CARNY opens the gate, the Kids pile onto the ride, two by two. Josie reaches an empty car--the last on and gets in. The Carny holds the safety bar open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your partner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't--I don't have one--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (yelling loudly) I GOT A LONELY RIDE IN BUCKET SEVEN! (to Crowd) SINGLE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have to yell like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam, standing by a vendor, looks over and notices Josie's predicament.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's Loser that's holding  up the ride!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam walks up to the Josie's bucket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This seat taken?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (relieved) Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gets in. The ride JERKS into motion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (nervous) Whoa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start a slow ascent. Sam seems ill at ease.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you--scared?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna tell you something here,  and I hope it doesn't undermine my  position as an authority figure.  I'm a little afraid of heights.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're afraid of the Ferris wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, it's more the plunging  head first into the crowd part  that gets me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh right. The Spiderman incident.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (touched) You remember that story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course. I remember everything  from your class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They smile at each other. The smile is interrupted by a  HEAVY SWAYING of their bucket, caused by Tommy ROCKING in the bucket ahead. Sam looks a little green.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yoooooow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't look down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're facing the ground at this point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out of my control. (yelling to Tommy) TOMMY! CUT IT OUT! ENOUGH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tommy stops. Sam turns to Josie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (defensive) I said that as a chaperone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They start to ascend again. Sam relaxes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay This is okay. Smooth. (then) Can I ask you something? Do you  think I tell too many stories in  class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what makes you interesting. (beat, recovering) As a teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I would love to think I'm an  interesting teacher. I mean, I had  maybe one or two teachers in high  school who had any passion at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do. Seem to. Have passion. In  the classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to say that. You're my  student.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't have to say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look into each other's eyes just as Tommy RATTLES hi bucket ruthlessly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: IF THE BUCKET'S A-ROCKIN', DON'T  COME-A KNOCKIN'.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and Sam laugh uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like to tell you that we all  grow out of it, but that's a lie.  Some of us will always be rattling  cages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you do that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. And you know what's  scary--when you get older it just  gets more confusing. I've spent  the last ten years with women who  are basically all wrong for me. (beat) You know what, I shouldn't be  talking about this stuff with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay. It's nice to have  someone to talk to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bucket is rocked again by Tommy--Sam grips the safety bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as he rocks) Same here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stop rocking but they're still stuck at the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All I can tell you is that when  you're my age, the guys will be  lined up around the block for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (suddenly shy) You have to say that. You're my  teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't say that, because I'm  your teacher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at each other, their smiles fading into  realization. Suddenly, the car jerks, and they start to  move down. Josie and Sam are pulled out of their reverie. They smile awkwardly at each other and laugh a small laug WIDE SHOT of the Ferris wheel as Josie and Sam descend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Josie. This wasn't as bad  as I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are you going to open your  eyes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm thinking when I'm home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob sits with a bunch of BASEBALL PLAYERS. MATZ and PACKE the studs of the team, come into the dugout and join them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Rob, thanks for showing me  that new grip. It totally changed  my swing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem, man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They do one of those elaborate, fraternity-like handshake Out of the corner of his eye, Rob sees Josie walking alon across the field. He gets an idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, you guys know that girl, Josie  Geller?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mean "Loser"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dude, Josie. We used to go out  and she dumped me. But we're still  good friends. And she isВ… amazing,  if you know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guys are all stunned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibby stands staring at a skeleton with Rob and the Cool  Girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right--that's it. Just water  and Ex-Lax till prom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--Josie's Dad invented that  stuff. Josie's like the heiress to  the Ex- Lax fortune.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (impressed) SHUT UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. She's loaded. She spends all  her vacations on the family yacht  in the south of France.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob stands behind the bleachers with Tommy, Jason, and  Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She used to date the drummer for  The Big Bad Voodoo Daddys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No way. I always wanted to be a  drummer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah well, she left him for the  drummer from "Sister Hazel." Y'know  the song "All for You?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was about Josie? (impressed) RufusВ…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie turns with her tray after paying. Aldys sees her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Josie--I'm really sorry I  snapped at you. Do you wanna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie sees Rob waving her over to "the table" where Krist Gibby and the gang sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Aldys, y'know, I have to--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Josie walks over to Guy's table, leaving Aldys starin after her. Josie sits down at the table. Everyone stares  at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Josie. It's Josie, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I just say--I totally love Ex- Lax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Okay, that's good to know--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you dated Big Bad  Voodoo Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie shoots a look at Rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I told you--Josie doesn't  like to talk about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Tommy, that's totally gochay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think it's pronounced gauche.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah it's French. There's no accent  aigue, so the e is soft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silent beat. Josie thinks she may have blown it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh, of course you would know that.  From being on your yacht in the  south of France.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all smile at her. Josie soaks in her newfound  popularity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the walls are SAFE SEX posters. On the front desk,  pamphlets on sexually transmitted diseases share space  with plastic biology cross-section models of male and fem reproductive organs. Sam stands in front of his English class, impatiently  looking at his watch. Josie looks up from her desk, sees  Anita waving wildly from the other side of the glass door Josie's eyes widen, she starts to make "get out of here"  movements. Sam notices Josie and follows her gaze to Anit He opens the door, speaks sotto to Anita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. You're here for the sex talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (happily taken aback) Well. I like a man who gets to the  point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're Pam?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (frisky) If you say so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam turns to the class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome juniors and seniors, this  is Pam Kitterman. She's our district  health counselor. She's here to  lead our sex discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ushers a surprised Anita to the front of the room. Jos reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am? Oh, I am. Hi. Okay. Sex.  Yes, well, sex. What's to say  really, y'know? You like a guy,  you do it. Sometimes he calls.  Sometimes he doesn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita leans into Josie, talks sotto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering) Hi!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (also whispering)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had a lunch break so I thought  I'd come by and see you. Your  teacher is a fox! (then normal voice  to Josie) Why don't we discuss that after  class. But the burning is totally  normal. (looking at watch) Oh look. Class is over already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought this was a 45-minute  seminar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita walks back to the front of the classroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, sex. Let's see. Sex is really  fun. (off Josie's look) When you're old enough. Which none  of you are, trust me I should know  cuz when you lose it to some guy  named Junior with really bad breath  in the back of a van at a Guns and  Roses concert you're gonna wish  you listened to your Mom when she  said, y'know, no one's gonna want  to buy the whole friggin ice cream  truck when you're handing out the  popsicles for free.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a deafening silence. The kids are amazed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. Any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Kids all have bananas and condoms. They are in variou stages of putting the condom over the banana. Anita walks among them, clearly more comfortable with her role now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay. I know it's hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Titters from the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Difficult. But safe sex is really  important. I try to practice it  every day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie reacts. ANGLE ON KIRSTEN & KRISTEN. Their condoms are snugly on  their bananas. They stare at Josie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: wait, rewind. Do you really think  she hooked-up with our Rob? They're  so--different.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sometimes opposites attract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Look at Bert and Ernie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE ANGLE ON ANITA. She's walking authoritatively up the  aisle towards the front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So just..imagine the bananas are  the real thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She takes a rather large banana off a desk and looks at  it. She snorts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a land called "every man's  fantasy".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She looks up, sees the real MISS KITTERMAN (we can tell from the model of a uterus she carries),  standing outside the door and waving. Without missing a  beat, Anita pulls down a shade on the door and locks it. ANGLE ON: JOSIE AND TRACY still struggling with condoms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God, I can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe because we're not supposed  to be having sex with bananas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what, though? I feel like  I'm really ready to do it. To have  sex for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That's big. I mean sex is a  really big deal. You shouldn't do  it until you know you've found the  right person.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON SAM, listening. Josie is oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, Adele penguins pick one  mate. They spend their whole life  looking for that one other penguin  and when they find it, they know.  That's the penguin they stay with  for the rest of their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I'm not a penguin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an analogy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A surprised Josie looks up to see Sam next to her. She  lets her condom go. And it flies off her banana into his  face. Josie turns to Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. I have to go die now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The class is interrupted by Sydney over the loudspeaker:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over speaker) Hey guys--Sydney again! Don't forget-- No going into the library cuz of  that little asbestos problem. And  about promВ—

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone freezes. Dead silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really bad news. We just got the  word from intelligence-- Northglen  High is doing the Millennium too!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Complete chaos. SCREAMING terror. A GIRL faints. Sera  squeezes her banana so hard it oozes out of its skin. Oth KIDS are beating their bananas against desktops. Brett,  the football player, absentmindedly peels his banana and  begins eating it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All right guys, let's calm down.  Calm down. (no response) Sit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all do, including Anita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now look. Let's focus. Prom theme.  We need a new idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OH! How about "Under the Sea?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's met with a round of "boos". Anita reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the "Roaring Twenties"В…  or "The 80's"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Class lets out a GIANT GROAN on that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think we are? Amateurs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not a theme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Josie will have the answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long beat. Expectant faces all turn to Josie. She looks at Tracy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about--' (coming to her) meant for each other--Famous couples  throughout history?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another beat as the Class considers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (smiles and nods) Yeah. That's it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Class suddenly CONCURS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. /That's it. /Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie soaks in all the approval like a sponge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie looks from Sam and Anita's smiling faces to find Gu smiling at her. CLOSE UP ON A BANNER reading: "MILLENNIUM". It comes down replaced by one that reads: "MEANT FOR EACH OTHER... WIDE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and the Cool Girls walk under the banner, laughing. We PAN UP to their lapels and see that they are all weari replicas of Josie-'s geeky airplane pin. They pass Aldys, Josie is oblivious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and the Girls walk four abreast, like a pack of pro lions. Kids part to let them through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WORKERS look at their watches, run into Gus's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam and Josie have fun painting a backdrop of the sunset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Workers stand around Gus's TV, riveted by Josie and Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and the Girls try on lipstick, laughing and fooling around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and Sam pick out CDs from a DJ's case. Josie picks  one out and puts it in the "yes" pile. Sam picks it up,  wrinkles his nose, puts it back. When he looks away, Josi sneaks it back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie's hiding behind a rack of clothes, talking on her  cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) I'm telling you Gus. It's a great  story. They keep the tags on, then  return the clothes after they've  worn them. (beat) Gus?--Gus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsten discovers Josie behind the rack. Josie quickly  pulls a cardigan off a rack, feigning interest in it. The Girls all do the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and the Girls, wearing matching cardigans, walk pas Aldys and another Denominator on their way to the escalat Josie and Aldys lock eyes and Josie smiles but Aldys turn her back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Denominator) Look, there goes another Lemming.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE ANGLE ON the escalator as Josie and the Girls rise sin file out of- FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie sits with her new friends, emulating them by sunnin in a bikini top and shorts while they watch the game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie, you have totally  transitioned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Transitioned?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You crossed over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Into our group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's really hard to do. Some kids  try for all of-high school and  never make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wannabes. Kirsten transitioned  last year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her dad sold a car to Leonardo Di  Caprio's uncle and before he picked  it up, her dad let us all sit in  it and take pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Josie) Wait. Do you know any gay guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'd love to transition a gay guy  into the group.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're very evolved.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIELD
dialogues.text: A BALL sails fast and hard. It looks like it's going to b a base hit, into left Field, but the shortstop leaps up  and grabs it. That shortstop is Rob. The Team cheers. Coa Romano heads out of the dugout towards Rob.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE STANDS
dialogues.text: Josie and the Gang leap up and cheer. Josie almost loses  her top, but catches it, just as Guy comes around the sid of the stands and notices Josie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coach Romano approaches Rob. Slaps him on the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great playing, Rob. You might be  just what Southglen South needs to  get to Nationals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm playing in the championship  game?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Playing? You're starting shortstop.  And I don't mean to put more  pressure on you but there are going  to be some pro scouts there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob grabs Coach Romano in a bear hug. The Coach is  uncomfortable. Rob moves towards the dugout and the Coach happily slaps him on the ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and the Girls are leaving. Guy catches up to them  and taps Josie on the shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So--you going to the party at Rob's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie's taken aback. The Girls notice Guy's interest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, you gonna be there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie stumbles on a step Guy immediately reaches out to  steady her. She melts. She can't even speak, so she just  nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. I'll see you tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is totally crunching on you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (confused) Do I want to be crunched?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By Guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CAMERA PANS the faces of some dull-looking workers. It  stops on Josie, who stands out in her teen garb and huge  knapsack. A star struck female WORKER turns to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really loved you in the sex-ed  scene.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie spills out the elevator and races through the bullp with Rhoda in pursuit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Splendiferous--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie stops, turns back to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie keeps going. A confused Rhoda stares after her. She passes Merkin's desk. He is still on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) No way ... Yeah? ... No way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie reaches over, grabs the phone out of his hand and  hangs up without missing a beat. She continues on as Merk stares after her. Josie reaches the conference room door. An older WOMAN runs out crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rigfort presides over a staff meeting. CLOSE UP on stunne office WORKERS' faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alrighty then--next on the agenda- sack races at the company picnic- yes or no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie sneaks in. She pushes past workers to get to a chai big backpack whacking them as she goes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi. Sorry I'm late. (pushing past chairs) Sorry. Excuse me--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie takes the chair next to Anita's. Anita looks her up and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sotto) I love that jacket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss Geller, what's the status on  your story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh it's great. Totally Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and Anita look at each other, both mouthing "Rufus?"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have, um--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie dumps out her backpack on the table. Teen items spi out-notebooks, CDs, barrettes, a hacky sac, a Frisbee,  glitter nail polish. She rifles through it all--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --notes here somewhere- (picking up paper) There's my math homework!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Geller, I don't need your notes. I  need your story. Though I speak  for everyone when I say I've seen  the tapes. Compelling stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the workers nod in agreement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I want a story in two weeks.  I'm saving the "Life and Style"  cover for you. You're gonna make  one hell of a reporter. Oh, and if  you don't, you and Gus are fired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and Gus react.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now, onto the next order of  business. Marketing department-yes  or no?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beer cans and kids litter the lawn. Josie pulls into the  driveway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie makes her way through the THRONGS OF KIDS. It's a  big high school "rager" lots of big blue keg cups, drunk  girls, etc. The cool Girls are present and socializing.  Josie finally makes her way to the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob is mixing margaritas, wearing a big sombrero. Tracy  sits on the counter, gazing lovingly at Rob's every move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Rob, what's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Rob's prom date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie glares at Rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? (pulling Rob aside) Rob-, that girl is sixteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And a gymnast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's sixteen years old, Rob. That's  totally and completely illegal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie feels an arm around her shoulder. It's Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. There.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy takes Josie's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here. I want to ask you  something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob watches them leaving the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Josie, calling  after) See you around the cellblock, Mrs.  Robinson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie turns around and gives him a death look. Tracy turn to Rob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob, what do you want to be when  you grow up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, a ball player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know. But, what if you don't  make it? 'I mean, you don t Want  to be working at a mail place the  rest of your life. It's okay for  an after school job, but, come on,  "hi, I'm Rob and I run the Tiki  Post"?! Totally lame.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy starts to giggle. Rob does not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy and Josie stand in front of Josie's old room. A bicyc license plate that says-"JOSIE" is nailed to the door. Sh stands in front of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should go in a different  room?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I already checked. There are some  pretty serious couples in there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy reaches for the doorknob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They go in. Josie sees her spelling bee trophies- with he name. She turns them around, trying to appear nonchalant. As Guy enters, he eyes the trophies, the stuffed animals, the many sets of encyclopedias.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, Rob's sister must be such a  loser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie manages a weak smile. Guy sits on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here, sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sits on the bed, and then sees a picture of her and  her family on the bedside table. She dives across the bed to overturn it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sure you've probably heard  that I want to ask you, but I'd  like to know if you'd go to prom  with me. I know we Didn't hit it  off right at the beginning but-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'll go. Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy leans in as if to kiss her and whispers...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rufus. (then pulling away) But I don't even know where you  live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what?  Why don't you just  pick me up here? We could all share  a limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. I'll catch you later.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy leaves. Josie is ecstatic and flops back on her bed.  Stuffed animals fall all around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and Rob walk confidently through the hallway. Kids  greet and high five them both.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jos. Hey Robster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking good guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Jos. Rob, rufus kegger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob and Josie turn the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob, this is unbelievable. I mean--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie shoves through the double doors leading into the  gym.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is a flurry of activity, a staging area for pro Various committees are set up at tables throughout the  room. Josie and Rob enter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --I spent my whole life wanting to  fit in, and now--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibby and Kirsten run up to Josie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey Josie- who did Archie date  Betty or Veronica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibby turns to Kirsten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Told you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they move off. Rob spots Tracy and moves off to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always liked Betty better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie turns, sees Sam.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You did?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they begin to walk through the prom prop area, and it begins to appear like a romantic date--they pass flowers, he picks one out, they pass a bistro table, a backdrop of a sunset follows them for awhile, etc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Betty was so spunky and  fun. Veronica may have had great  legs, but she was too moody. Very  high maintenance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie laughs. ANGLE ON: A TABLE where Kristen and Tommy are selling pro tickets. Aldys is standing in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't not sell me a ticket to  prom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, Alpo--we can do whatever  we want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I get it. It's that pesky making  change part that's confusing you  guys. Here. I'll make it easy. (holding up money) Money- (drops money, takes  ticket) Ticket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aldys takes her ticket, walks off. Tommy and Kristen turn to each other and start whispering conspiratorially.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sera runs up to Josie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie, were Tweedle Dee and Tweedle  Dum a couple?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and Sam share a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, in a strict sense, probably  not. But for prom--sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sera turns off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really doing a great job  here, Josie. I like your "can do"  attitude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shyly) Thanks. (beat) They weren't related to Humpty  Dumpty, were they? Tweedle Dum and  Tweedle Dee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe distant cousins. They did  have that egg shape in common.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Humpty Dumpty was alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sad, isn't it? He had to  sit on that wall all by himself.  He deserved to have somebody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's really what we all need,  right? Someone to sit up on the  wall with us--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. To watch the world go by.--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To put us back together again when  we fall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They share a meaningful glance and a smile.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our penguin, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think you'll find her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, actually I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are lost in each other. They lean closer, as if they may kiss, then Sam breaks the moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! I almost forgot--I got  you a meeting with the admissions  guy from Dartmouth!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What! But--I wasn't even going to  go to college--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know, but I pulled some  strings, got him to look at your  writing, and he agreed to meet  you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh--yikes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: told him (teasing) --if I'm wrong about this girl,  you can take away my teaching  certificate!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. You believe in me that much--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I do. Josie, you owe it  to yourself--to your writing, to  go to college. You're a great  writer. You just have to find your  story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As they share a meaningful look, WE FREEZE FRAME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus and Josie sit in front of his TV. The image of Sam an Josie is frozen on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's your story!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're crazy. I can't--I can't-no.  No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's got it all--sex, intrigue,  immorality in the education system--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's my teacher!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's the best part. (bannering with his  hands) "Teacher-Student Relations: How  close is too close?" We're gonna  blow the lid off it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is no lid! Nothing's going  on between Sam and me. Coulson.  Mr. Sam Coulson and me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not yet. Every person in this office  comes in here and watches you guys!   It's like the goddamn Young and  the Restless! Rigfort's salivating  over it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You already pitched this to  Rigfort?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gus leans in, now all business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie, this isn't a joke. You heard  Rigfort. It's both of our asses on  the line. This is your story.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie is getting ready for prom. She wears her bathrobe  and is doing her make-up. She looks over at her dresser  where she eyes the camera/flight wings pin tentatively.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob, in boxers, a dress shirt, and socks is filling flask with vodka. Josie comes in the door wearing a lovely  Elizabethan gown. She looks absolutely beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow, Josie- you look really-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (hopeful) Rufus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. Exactly. Major Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. And what are -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duh. Tom Cruise. "Risky Business".

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He puts on his black wayfarer sunglasses, and does the  famous slide into the living room. Josie laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob--thanks. For everything. This  is really happening. I never thought--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob smiles and exits. Josie nervously checks her reflection in the T.V. - just  like she did eight years ago. She takes a deep breath, an goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie comes out on the porch, and sees the limo rounding  the corner, just like eight years before. The sunroof ope And Guy stands up - holding something. Josie panics - and starts to take cover - but then sees  he's holding a dozen white roses. And holding them out to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on beautiful - what are you  waiting for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie, smiling, runs down the driveway to the limo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Prom night. And it really is magical. Twinkling lights do the trees, MUSIC wafts out from the club. A neon sign tha says "Meant For Each Other" blinks above the building.-  COUPLES make their way inside. We see MORK a MINDY, ANTON a CLEOPATRA and Sera dressed as a RABBIT. Annoyed, she  turns back to her lagging date, Brett, dressed as a  TORTOISE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello! If you don't hurry up we're  gonna miss the whole thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gibby, Kirsten, and Kristen exit limos with their DATES.  They all wear the same straight blonde wig, and look at  each other in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh-my-God. You totally ripped off  my Malibu Barbie idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh uh. I'm Disco Barbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kirsten's wearing a short, tight miniskirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm Evening Gown Barbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. That's not an evening gown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is on Barbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie and Guy approach, dressed in Elizabethan costume.  They look great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie, you look Rufus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't tell me... You're Medieval  Barbie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rosalind and Orlando. (nothing) From "As You Like It"? (more blank stares) Shakespeare?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like talking to a sack of hammers. Guy interjects.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look! I get to have a sword!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they all ooh and ahh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FOLLOW Josie and the group into the prom. The place  looks amazing. Lights, ice sculptures, champagne fountain WE PAN DOWN the buffet. A BOY dressed as a jar of PEANUT BUTTER and his date, JEL are getting food. Peanut Butter turns away from the buffe and bumps into a GIRL dressed as a CHOCOLATE BAR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: oh, sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's a magical beat as they smile at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jelly looks on, chagrined. We reach two OLDER GENTLEMEN in tuxes who carry clipboard and wear big buttons that read: NATIONAL PROM JUDGE. They contemplate the ice sculpture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's deft and unique without being  derivative.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (looking off) Hey! Pigs in blankets!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And he runs off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie sits with the COOL GROUP at a table. Kristen is mak odd faces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm practicing my surprised face  for when we get named to prom court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOSEPH and a very pregnant MARY approach their table and  try to sit down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. There's no room at this  table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joseph and Mary amble off. Guy turns to Josie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You having fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (meaning it) Oh yeah. The best. Josie takes in  the spectacle around her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Candles are lit. George's Date sits on the couch. The  monitor is on showing the JOSIE CAM POV. He flips the switch, the lights dim and a small disco bal starts moving slowly. George settles in next to his Date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire office is crammed into Gus's office. Anita sit up front, spellbound, watching the JOSIE CAM. Gus stands  in back. Okay, he's a little interested too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the most beautiful prom I  have ever been to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cynthia runs in with a bowl of popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did I miss the crowning?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I'm closing the pool in  five minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Merkin holds out a bowl of cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie's odds are 3 to 1. 2 to 1  for Prom court. And even odds the  kid sticks himself with the sword  by the end of the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE PAN ACROSS the dance floor where we see POPEYE & OLIVE OYL, SONNY & CHER, the BLUES BROTHERS. WE HOLD on ROBIN dancing with BATGIRL. BATMAN approached  and taps Robin's shoulder--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I have this dance-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Batgirl steps aside--Robin and Batman dance happily  away.

dialogues.speaker: ROB TRYING TO SLOW DANCE WITH TRACY
dialogues.text: (dressed like REBECCA De MORNAY), but she is so-drunk she having trouble balancing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you having fun?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tries to stand her up on her own.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good. Gibby gave me champagne.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should sit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He helps her to a chair next to the dance floor. They bot sit. Next to them, a ravenous MISS PIGGY eats with her  date KERMIT looking on. She picks up an hors d'oeuvre and stares at it horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh my God! Is this a pig in a  blanket?!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracy looks at Rob, and gets serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob, I've - I've thought about it  a lot. And I think- I mean, I know.  You're the one. My penguin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob looks at her. She's young. She's beautiful. She's tip She's trying to put her legs behind her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow - I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob, I mean it. I want you to be  my first. Me and you. Once the  floor stops spinning, let's have  sex.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks around. It's high school prom. A skinny kid is  getting beat up in a corner. Other kids are sneaking smok He can't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna get you some water. And  then, I think we should get back  out on that dance floor and boogie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rob gets up, kisses Tracy on the top of her head, and hea for the refreshment table. Tracy, her leg still around he head falls backwards into Kermit's lap. Kermit looks down surprised and interested. Miss Piggy notices, gives him a big "Harumph", tosses her hair, and leaves. ANGLE BACK ON: THE COOL TABLE. Gibby is staring O.S. in horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys--what is the one thing  that could ruin my senior prom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you would trip on your Barbie  heels and I'd get named prom queen? (beat) Did I say that out loud?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WE FOLLOW Kristen's stare to the prom entrance where Aldy and the Denominators enter in pairs, one behind the other attached together with rope, to form a human ladder. They cross the dance floor, interrupting everything with their unwieldy, tied-together conga line. They approach the Coo Table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what are you supposed to be?  Other than freaks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're DNA. A double helix. But I  guess you'd know that if you'd  actually passed bio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen reaches out and touches the rope binding Denomina #1 to Aldys. Denominator #1 slaps her hand away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't touch the hydrogen.  It's rented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristen reacts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam takes the stage, with a card in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, the moment has arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at the card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our 1999 prom court - the princesses  are - Miss Kristen Rey, Miss Kirsten  Leosis and Miss Gibby Zarefsky.  And the princes are Mr. Thomas  Salamey, Mr. Jason Way, and Mr.  Rob -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks at the card, and then looks around. Nobody can  help him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Rob ... Mr. Rob!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd cheers. Gibby, Kirsten, and Kristen all jump in preplanned delight. Rob seems genuinely surprised. Jason  carries Tommy up to the stage piggyback. The girls make  their way to the stage, and put on their "PROM COURT"  sashes. Sam looks to the card again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next up - Southglen's Prom KingВ…

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy is already halfway to the stage-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guy Perkins!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd goes wild. Guy reaches the stage and takes his  crown and scepter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And - this year's prom queen -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam looks at the card, then at Josie. Josie is standing;  eyes open, staring at the podium...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crowd is rapt, waiting for the announcement. Anita ha her eyes squeezed shut, praying for the win... INT. COUNTRY CLUB - ANGLE ON SAM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ladies and gentlemen В– Josie Geller!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crowd CHEERS like crazy, Josie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Crowd goes crazy, hugging each other and jumping up  and down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes! You go girl! Yes! Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anita gives Gus a big hug. Gus is completely taken aback. Merkin dolefully hands out money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie is hugged and congratulated as she makes her way,  elated, to the stage. Sam places the Queen's tiara on her head and hands her a bouquet of flowers. They lock eyes  for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And now - as it is custom - the  king and queen will have their  first dance.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE DANCE FLOOR
dialogues.text: Guy and Josie begin to dance. From Josie's P.O.V., it's i SLOW MOTION, the world glittering and wonderful around  her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey--what are you thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shakespeare. How he described a  night like this--"Look how the  floor of heaven is thick inlaid  with patines of bright gold". (beat) What about you? What are you  thinking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (taking a beat,  happily) My sword.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like a switch has been flicked on in Josie's brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie, you rock my world. You're  like the most amazing girl I've  ever dated. You're so smart and  fun and crazy! You rock my world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You said that already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie stands by the buffet in her tiara, turns and comes  face to face with Sam. They're both taken aback by the  other's beauty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Josie--you make a really beautiful  prom queen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. So do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They both laugh, embarrassed, at Josie's flub.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always feel like such a goofball  in these penguin suits. Like I'm  at my own wedding or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He gestures towards the dance floor. Josie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay--

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they walk off onto the dance floor. ANGLE ON: THE SIDE OF THE DANCE FLOOR. Guy approaches Aldys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, listen--it's prom. How about  we let all the old shit go. Would  you like to dance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aldys can't help it. She smiles, a little flattered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it's okay with the rest of the  double helix.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Aldys smiles and unhooks herself from the group. And star to dance with Guy. ANGLE ON: JOSIE AND SAM as they continue to dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Proms always make me sad. They're  so final. Graduation. Everyone's  scattering, moving on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, are you here with anybody?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I'm alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's weird because "prom" is  actually from the word "promenade".  And you can't really promenade  alone, can you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
